{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Restaurant Manager",
  "description": "Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Reports to: Food &amp; Beverage Manager/ General Manager
Direct Reports: Supervisors, Waitstaff, Hosts/Hostesses, Bartenders, and Kitchen Coordination Staff

Main Function


	The Restaurant Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations and service delivery of the hotel&rsquo;s fine-dining restaurant, ensuring world-class guest experiences, operational excellence, and revenue growth.
	The ideal candidate must have in-depth experience in luxury hospitality dining, exceptional leadership and guest-relations skills, and the ability to uphold the brand standards of a 5-star establishment.


Role Responsibilities
Restaurant Operations and Service Excellence:


	Manage the daily restaurant floor operations, ensuring efficiency, attention to detail, and premium guest experiences.
	Oversee the execution of &agrave; la carte, buffet, and private dining services in accordance with hotel standards.


Team Leadership and Supervision:


	Lead, train, and motivate a high-performing service team including hosts, servers, and stewards.
	Create and manage staff schedules, performance reviews, and ongoing service training programs.


Guest Experience and Complaint Resolution:


	Engage with guests to ensure satisfaction and personalized service.
	Resolve complaints and special requests promptly and professionally to uphold guest loyalty.


Inventory, Cost, and Quality Control:


	Monitor food and beverage inventory, order supplies, and reduce waste.
	Collaborate with chefs and bar managers to maintain menu quality, presentation, and food safety standards.


Revenue Management and Sales Growth:


	Work with the hotel&rsquo;s sales and events teams to promote special dining events, group bookings, and seasonal campaigns.
	Monitor daily sales performance, track KPIs, and implement initiatives to increase profitability.


Health, Safety, and Compliance:


	Ensure strict adherence to hygiene, sanitation, and safety protocols in line with health regulations.
	Maintain documentation and readiness for inspections or audits.


Reporting and Administrative Tasks:


	Prepare shift reports, staff attendance, and service incident logs.
	Submit weekly operational and financial reports to senior management.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or HND in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of progressive experience in restaurant or F&amp;B operations, with at least 2 years in a managerial role within a 4 or 5-star hotel.
	Certifications in Food Safety, Hospitality Service Excellence, or F&amp;B Operations are an added advantage.
	Proven track record in luxury service environments, international cuisine operations, and fine-dining management.


Skills:


	Leadership and People Management
	Strong leadership and team-building skills todrivehigh service standards and staff morale.
	Ability to coach, delegate, and lead by example in a fast-paced environment.
	Guest-Centric Mindset
	Exceptional communication, emotional intelligence, and interpersonal skills.
	Deep commitment to delivering unforgettable guest experiences.
	Operational and Financial Acumen
	Skilled in restaurant budgeting, cost control, inventory management, and revenue analysis.
	Proficiency in POS systems, reservation software, and Microsoft Office tools.
	Crisis Management and Problem Solving
	Ability to make quick, informed decisions during peak service hours or service disruptions.
	Strong conflict resolution and guest complaint handling skills.
	Attention to Detail and Presentation
	Excellent sense of cleanliness, layout, service flow, and aesthetic coordination.
	Upholds brand image and service etiquette.


Method&nbsp; of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs and cover letters to&nbsp;recruitment@domeoresources.org&nbsp;with &quot;Restaurant Manager&quot; as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

Restaurant Manager Job at Domeo Resources International




        
    

        
        Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Reports to: Food & Beverage Manager/ General Manager
Direct Reports: Supervisors, Waitstaff, Hosts/Hostesses, Bartenders, and Kitchen Coordination Staff

Main Function
     

            
    




	The Restaurant Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations and service delivery of the hotel’s fine-dining restaurant, ensuring world-class guest experiences, operational excellence, and revenue growth.
	The ideal candidate must have in-depth experience in luxury hospitality dining, exceptional leadership and guest-relations skills, and the ability to uphold the brand standards of a 5-star establishment.


Role Responsibilities
Restaurant Operations and Service Excellence:


	Manage the daily restaurant floor operations, ensuring efficiency, attention to detail, and premium guest experiences.
	Oversee the execution of à la carte, buffet, and private dining services in accordance with hotel standards.


Team Leadership and Supervision:


	Lead, train, and motivate a high-performing service team including hosts, servers, and stewards.
	Create and manage staff schedules, performance reviews, and ongoing service training programs.


Guest Experience and Complaint Resolution:


	Engage with guests to ensure satisfaction and personalized service.
	Resolve complaints and special requests promptly and professionally to uphold guest loyalty.


Inventory, Cost, and Quality Control:


	Monitor food and beverage inventory, order supplies, and reduce waste.
	Collaborate with chefs and bar managers to maintain menu quality, presentation, and food safety standards.


Revenue Management and Sales Growth:


	Work with the hotel’s sales and events teams to promote special dining events, group bookings, and seasonal campaigns.
	Monitor daily sales performance, track KPIs, and implement initiatives to increase profitability.


Health, Safety, and Compliance:


	Ensure strict adherence to hygiene, sanitation, and safety protocols in line with health regulations.
	Maintain documentation and readiness for inspections or audits.


Reporting and Administrative Tasks:


	Prepare shift reports, staff attendance, and service incident logs.
	Submit weekly operational and financial reports to senior management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5–7 years of progressive experience in restaurant or F&B operations, with at least 2 years in a managerial role within a 4 or 5-star hotel.
	Certifications in Food Safety, Hospitality Service Excellence, or F&B Operations are an added advantage.
	Proven track record in luxury service environments, international cuisine operations, and fine-dining management.


Skills:


	Leadership and People Management
	Strong leadership and team-building skills todrivehigh service standards and staff morale.
	Ability to coach, delegate, and lead by example in a fast-paced environment.
	Guest-Centric Mindset
	Exceptional communication, emotional intelligence, and interpersonal skills.
	Deep commitment to delivering unforgettable guest experiences.
	Operational and Financial Acumen
	Skilled in restaurant budgeting, cost control, inventory management, and revenue analysis.
	Proficiency in POS systems, reservation software, and Microsoft Office tools.
	Crisis Management and Problem Solving
	Ability to make quick, informed decisions during peak service hours or service disruptions.
	Strong conflict resolution and guest complaint handling skills.
	Attention to Detail and Presentation
	Excellent sense of cleanliness, layout, service flow, and aesthetic coordination.
	Upholds brand image and service etiquette.


Method  of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs and cover letters to recruitment@domeoresources.org with "Restaurant Manager" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Qualification Engineer",
  "description": "Founded in 1987, Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. We have approximately 208,000 employees and we operate in over 170 countries and regions, serving more than three billion people around the world. We are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Qualification Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Work content:


	Implement procurement strategies for engineering service categories, manage procurement businesses from E2E to Payment, ensure continuous supply of the corresponding categories, ensure efficient and high-quality delivery, and optimize comprehensive costs, and support the construction of the corresponding category ecosystem.
	Develop supplier selection strategies, organize negotiations with suppliers, and sign contracts.
	Establish, maintain, and optimize the procurement commercial and cost baselines for categories, and ensure the competitive advantage of categories in terms of costs.
	Distribution and assurance of delivery resources: Take charge of the sourcing of managed categories, build the pattern of delivery resources, and ensure stable delivery. Develop delivery resource assurance measures, make arrangements in advance to match supply and demand, coordinate supplier resources to support successful project delivery, and prevent major delivery and quality problems.
	Supplier relationship management: Establish and maintain relationships with suppliers, organize and implement procurement activities such as supplier qualification, selection, performance management, portfolio management, collaboration, and development, and ensure that the supplier obtains the relative competitive edge in procurement.
	Establish a sound internal control environment, implement internal control measures, ensure operation security, and ensure internal and external business compliance.


Work Competency Requirements


	At least 5 years of procurement-related work experience, good cross-department promotion and execution capabilities, familiar with project delivery processes, and familiar with business knowledge and procurement models in the communications industry.
	Be proficient in commercial and compliance knowledge, and understand basic financial and tax knowledge.
	Strong project management ability, proficient in project management methods, good organization and communication skills, procurement and business negotiation experience. Good interpersonal and negotiation skills with suppliers and internal customers;
	Have good risk control awareness, be able to quickly identify risks, and develop risk control solutions.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;nigeriahr23@huawei.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted",

Procurement Qualification Engineer Job at  Huawei Technologies




        
    

        
        Founded in 1987, Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. We have approximately 208,000 employees and we operate in over 170 countries and regions, serving more than three billion people around the world. We are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Qualification Engineer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Work content:
     

            
    




	Implement procurement strategies for engineering service categories, manage procurement businesses from E2E to Payment, ensure continuous supply of the corresponding categories, ensure efficient and high-quality delivery, and optimize comprehensive costs, and support the construction of the corresponding category ecosystem.
	Develop supplier selection strategies, organize negotiations with suppliers, and sign contracts.
	Establish, maintain, and optimize the procurement commercial and cost baselines for categories, and ensure the competitive advantage of categories in terms of costs.
	Distribution and assurance of delivery resources: Take charge of the sourcing of managed categories, build the pattern of delivery resources, and ensure stable delivery. Develop delivery resource assurance measures, make arrangements in advance to match supply and demand, coordinate supplier resources to support successful project delivery, and prevent major delivery and quality problems.
	Supplier relationship management: Establish and maintain relationships with suppliers, organize and implement procurement activities such as supplier qualification, selection, performance management, portfolio management, collaboration, and development, and ensure that the supplier obtains the relative competitive edge in procurement.
	Establish a sound internal control environment, implement internal control measures, ensure operation security, and ensure internal and external business compliance.


Work Competency Requirements


	At least 5 years of procurement-related work experience, good cross-department promotion and execution capabilities, familiar with project delivery processes, and familiar with business knowledge and procurement models in the communications industry.
	Be proficient in commercial and compliance knowledge, and understand basic financial and tax knowledge.
	Strong project management ability, proficient in project management methods, good organization and communication skills, procurement and business negotiation experience. Good interpersonal and negotiation skills with suppliers and internal customers;
	Have good risk control awareness, be able to quickly identify risks, and develop risk control solutions.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nigeriahr23@huawei.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Systems Engineer / IT Infrastructure Engineer",
  "description": "Huawei is a leading global ICT solutions provider. Through our dedication to customer-centric innovation and strong partnerships, we have established end-to-end capabilities and strengths across the carrier networks, enterprise, consumer, and cloud computing fields. Our products and solutions have been deployed in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world&#39;s population.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Systems Engineer / IT Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are looking for a skilled IT Systems Engineer to manage and maintain our IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have experience in delivering IT projects, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring smooth operations across systems, servers, and virtualisation platforms.


Key Responsibilities
Project Delivery and Maintenance:


	Deliver and maintain IT products and systems with minimal supervision, ensuring projects are completed on time and to specification.
	Independently handle system installation, optimisation, and troubleshooting.


Microsoft Exchange 2016/2019:


	Install, configure, and optimise Microsoft Exchange 2016/2019 across all modules.
	Troubleshoot, maintain, and resolve issues related to Exchange, leveraging 2-3 years of hands-on experience.


Windows Server 2016/2019 Administration:


	Manage and analyse logs related to system freezes, Blue Screen issues, unexpected reboots, etc.
	Investigate and identify root causes of issues, producing high-quality diagnostic reports.


Linux Administration:


	Maintain and troubleshoot Linux-based systems (approx. 3 years of experience).
	Ensure system performance and stability, resolving issues promptly.


Virtualisation (VMware):


	Administer VMware environments, ensuring efficient virtual machine management and performance.
	Apply virtualisation best practices to support system stability.


Commercial Servers and Storage;


	Manage and troubleshoot commercial server and storage systems (2+ years of experience).
	Perform hardware and software configurations, ensuring high availability and performance.


Cloud Platforms:


	Be familiar with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, and Azure.
	Implement and manage cloud-based solutions for improved business continuity and scalability.


Networking;


	Design, build, and optimise practical network architectures.
	Utilise basic Datacom skills to enhance system connectivity and network performance.


Product Upgrade and Compliance:


	Handle product upgrades (both software and hardware) for various IT systems and platforms.
	Ensure compliance with project requirements, standards, and vendor-specific guidelines.


Low-Level Design (LLD) and Topology Creation:


	Break down design requirements to create Low-Level Designs (LLD) and topology diagrams.
	Work on the overall infrastructure design, ensuring optimal delivery and performance based on environmental and customer needs.


Data Migration:


	Perform data migration from legacy physical servers or virtual machines to new virtualised platforms.
	Migrate data from old storage solutions to new systems with minimal downtime and disruption.


Project Management and Multi-tasking:


	Handle multiple IT tasks and projects concurrently, ensuring completion without missing deadlines.
	Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure projects align with organisational goals.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
	Relevant certifications (e.g., MCSE, VMware, Linux, AWS/Azure certifications) are a plus.


Experience:


	2-3 years of hands-on experience in Microsoft Exchange installation, optimisation, and troubleshooting.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Windows Server (2016/2019) administration and issue resolution.
	Minimum 3 years of experience working with Linux systems.
	At least 2 years of experience with virtualisation platforms (VMware).
	2+ years of experience working with commercial servers and storage systems.
	Experience working with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
	Proven experience with network design and implementation, including basic Datacom skills.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to produce high-quality reports and documentation.
	Knowledge of data migration processes and platform upgrades.
	Experience in creating Low-Level Designs (LLD) and network topologies.
	Familiarity with IT compliance and best practices in system design and delivery.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and clients.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;nigeriahr23@huawei.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-29",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

IT Systems Engineer / IT Infrastructure Engineer Job at Huawei




        
    

        
        Huawei is a leading global ICT solutions provider. Through our dedication to customer-centric innovation and strong partnerships, we have established end-to-end capabilities and strengths across the carrier networks, enterprise, consumer, and cloud computing fields. Our products and solutions have been deployed in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world's population.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Systems Engineer / IT Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview
     

            
    




	We are looking for a skilled IT Systems Engineer to manage and maintain our IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have experience in delivering IT projects, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring smooth operations across systems, servers, and virtualisation platforms.


Key Responsibilities
Project Delivery and Maintenance:


	Deliver and maintain IT products and systems with minimal supervision, ensuring projects are completed on time and to specification.
	Independently handle system installation, optimisation, and troubleshooting.


Microsoft Exchange 2016/2019:


	Install, configure, and optimise Microsoft Exchange 2016/2019 across all modules.
	Troubleshoot, maintain, and resolve issues related to Exchange, leveraging 2-3 years of hands-on experience.


Windows Server 2016/2019 Administration:


	Manage and analyse logs related to system freezes, Blue Screen issues, unexpected reboots, etc.
	Investigate and identify root causes of issues, producing high-quality diagnostic reports.


Linux Administration:


	Maintain and troubleshoot Linux-based systems (approx. 3 years of experience).
	Ensure system performance and stability, resolving issues promptly.


Virtualisation (VMware):


	Administer VMware environments, ensuring efficient virtual machine management and performance.
	Apply virtualisation best practices to support system stability.


Commercial Servers and Storage;


	Manage and troubleshoot commercial server and storage systems (2+ years of experience).
	Perform hardware and software configurations, ensuring high availability and performance.


Cloud Platforms:


	Be familiar with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, and Azure.
	Implement and manage cloud-based solutions for improved business continuity and scalability.


Networking;


	Design, build, and optimise practical network architectures.
	Utilise basic Datacom skills to enhance system connectivity and network performance.


Product Upgrade and Compliance:


	Handle product upgrades (both software and hardware) for various IT systems and platforms.
	Ensure compliance with project requirements, standards, and vendor-specific guidelines.


Low-Level Design (LLD) and Topology Creation:


	Break down design requirements to create Low-Level Designs (LLD) and topology diagrams.
	Work on the overall infrastructure design, ensuring optimal delivery and performance based on environmental and customer needs.


Data Migration:


	Perform data migration from legacy physical servers or virtual machines to new virtualised platforms.
	Migrate data from old storage solutions to new systems with minimal downtime and disruption.


Project Management and Multi-tasking:


	Handle multiple IT tasks and projects concurrently, ensuring completion without missing deadlines.
	Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure projects align with organisational goals.


Qualifications & Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
	Relevant certifications (e.g., MCSE, VMware, Linux, AWS/Azure certifications) are a plus.


Experience:


	2-3 years of hands-on experience in Microsoft Exchange installation, optimisation, and troubleshooting.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Windows Server (2016/2019) administration and issue resolution.
	Minimum 3 years of experience working with Linux systems.
	At least 2 years of experience with virtualisation platforms (VMware).
	2+ years of experience working with commercial servers and storage systems.
	Experience working with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
	Proven experience with network design and implementation, including basic Datacom skills.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to produce high-quality reports and documentation.
	Knowledge of data migration processes and platform upgrades.
	Experience in creating Low-Level Designs (LLD) and network topologies.
	Familiarity with IT compliance and best practices in system design and delivery.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and clients.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nigeriahr23@huawei.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Foreign Trade / Key Accounts Officer",
  "description": "Excellent Jobs is a consulting andrecruitment firm, dedicated to hiring and managing great talents for its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Foreign Trade / Key Accounts Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a skilled Foreign Trade/Key Accounts Officerwho will manage international trade operations and key customer relationships.
	This role involves handling export/import documentation, coordinating logistics, and building strong client relationships to drive sales and ensure customer satisfaction.
	In essence, a Foreign Trade/Key Accounts Officer is a vital link between a company and its international clients, ensuring smooth trade operations and driving business growth through strong customer relationships.


Job Description


	Responsible for foreign customer development activities, expertly take care of export orders from start to finish.
	Manage order inquiries and quotations from new and existing customers;
	Have an in-depth understanding of industry trends both locally &amp; internationally, and indispensable insights into product pricing movements.
	Building and maintaining strong relationships with key clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
	Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities within existing accounts.
	Monitoring account performance, identifying potential issues, and implementing solutions.
	Negotiating contracts and agreements with key clients.
	Providing regular reports on account activity and performance.


Qualifications


	2 years+ experience in foreign trade/key accounts officer, expertise in key accounts order follow-up.
	BSc/BA or HND in business administration, sales or relevant field.
	International Trade Knowledge:Understanding of export/import procedures, logistics, and international trade regulations.
	Key Account Management Skills:Relationship building, communication, negotiation, and sales skills.
	Communication Skills:Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and potentially other languages.
	Analytical Skills:Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make informed decisions.
	Problem-Solving Skills:Ability to identify and resolve issues effectively.
	Organizational Skills:Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize effectively, and meet deadlines.
	Computer Skills:Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite, CRM software, and other relevant applications.
	Financial Acumen:Understanding of financial statements and basic accounting principles.


Salary
N280,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;excellentjobs95@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-01",

Foreign Trade / Key Accounts Officer Job at Excellent Jobs




        
    

        
        Excellent Jobs is a consulting andrecruitment firm, dedicated to hiring and managing great talents for its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Foreign Trade / Key Accounts Officer

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a skilled Foreign Trade/Key Accounts Officerwho will manage international trade operations and key customer relationships.
	This role involves handling export/import documentation, coordinating logistics, and building strong client relationships to drive sales and ensure customer satisfaction.
	In essence, a Foreign Trade/Key Accounts Officer is a vital link between a company and its international clients, ensuring smooth trade operations and driving business growth through strong customer relationships.


Job Description


	Responsible for foreign customer development activities, expertly take care of export orders from start to finish.
	Manage order inquiries and quotations from new and existing customers;
	Have an in-depth understanding of industry trends both locally & internationally, and indispensable insights into product pricing movements.
	Building and maintaining strong relationships with key clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
	Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities within existing accounts.
	Monitoring account performance, identifying potential issues, and implementing solutions.
	Negotiating contracts and agreements with key clients.
	Providing regular reports on account activity and performance.


Qualifications


	2 years+ experience in foreign trade/key accounts officer, expertise in key accounts order follow-up.
	BSc/BA or HND in business administration, sales or relevant field.
	International Trade Knowledge:Understanding of export/import procedures, logistics, and international trade regulations.
	Key Account Management Skills:Relationship building, communication, negotiation, and sales skills.
	Communication Skills:Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and potentially other languages.
	Analytical Skills:Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make informed decisions.
	Problem-Solving Skills:Ability to identify and resolve issues effectively.
	Organizational Skills:Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize effectively, and meet deadlines.
	Computer Skills:Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite, CRM software, and other relevant applications.
	Financial Acumen:Understanding of financial statements and basic accounting principles.


Salary
N280,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: excellentjobs95@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

ICT Support Staff Job at MasterCare International School




        
    

        
        MasterCare International School was established in 2014 by the astute educationist, Her Excellency Dcns. Roli Nere Uduagan, in response to a mandate to raise godly and impactful leaders who would hold the reins of power without ethnic biases; future leaders who would render selfless service to man as unto God with global excellence.

MasterCare school comprises the Pre-school, the Junior Primary School, the Senior Primary School, the Junior Secondary School and the Senior School. The secondary school has the capacity to accommodate 1500 boarders. It is situated at a serene and exclusive area of Asaba, Delta State and shares same boundary (fence) with the Delta State House of Assembly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: ICT Support Staff

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Job type: Full-time

Requirements


	Applicants must possess relevant Degree in any related field
	Applicants must possess minimum of 3 years of teaching experience.
	Candidates living within Asaba and it's environs have an advantage.
	The successful candidate should be ready to resume as soon as possible.
	Applicants for the roles must possess the requisite skills and competencies.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV / Resume to: vacancy@mcis.sch.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates are to bring alongside, photocopies of their Credentials as well as original copies for sighting if invited.
